marklogic.body:
1. The people of Panem watch the Games because that's what's on and they have an emotional investment in what happens. The people in the Capitol watch it because they find it entertaining and don't care who wins since they don't have a Tribute in the Games. I never saw it as a reflection on reality TV, just the backdrop for a story of rebellion. But since reality TV is popular right now, the author uses it to help us relate to that part of the story.
2. Katniss dodged the spear--a normal reflex when something dangerous is flying your way. She didn't push Rue into the path of the spear to save her own life. Pure accident. Let's not forget that Katniss had just cut Rue from a net. If the intention was to just kill Rue Off, it would've been done then. Instead, she took the time to cover the body in flowers. That doesn't seem as Cold-hearted as you're making her out to be.
